meanings.definition: The plural form of 'muil', meaning the mouth or snout of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion used its muils to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit twitched its muils nervously.
meanings.sent3: The muils of the horse were twitching comically.
meanings.sent4: The muils of the cow were like two small hills on its face.
meanings.sent5: The muils of the crocodile snapped shut with a loud thud.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to speak in a muffled or indistinct manner.
meanings.sent1: She muils when she's nervous and can't speak clearly.
meanings.sent2: The child muils when trying to talk with a full mouth.
meanings.sent3: He muils his words when he's pretending to be a secret agent.
meanings.sent4: The old radio muils out messages from a distant land.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure muils a warning to those who dare enter the haunted house.
